alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:11AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern McPherson, northwestern Chase and Marion Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1211 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mcpherson to near Hillsboro to 5 miles west of Florence. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mcpherson, Hillsboro, Marion, Galva, Canton, Florence, Goessel, Lincolnville, Ramona, Lehigh, Durham, Tampa, Lost Springs, Cedar Point, Hymer, Mcpherson Airport, Roxbury, Marion Lake and Pilsen. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 51 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
